name: Johnny's Reef
address: 2 City Island Ave, Bronx, NY 10464, USA

reviews.text: Wanna eat some good seafood....like a lot of what you'll find at the restaurant but without the extra charges? Go for Johnny's. Plus the tartar sauce is amazing!
Always fresh and delicious here. Nice fellowship with family.
Always a pleasure. Efficiency, seed and quality the best
Muy agradable lugar, puedes sentarte dentro y fuera del local, al lado de la playa y disfruta al mirar las Gabiotas

A trip to City Island wouldn't be complete without some seafood by the water, and Johnny's Reef didn't disappoint. True, it's a little hectic and the the lines can be long, but  the wait isn't all that bad. It's all a part of the experience. We chose the fried shrimp and steamed squid in garlic sauce. Both were delicious.

Stopped for a quick lunch, simple no frills spot, laid back atmosphere, nice views. Had the galamah and a henny colada. Everything was great but the calamari was very "leggy" which I don't mind but I know some people do. Also be advised there's a lot of gulls in the parking lot so maybe don't go fresh off a car wash.
Great for family outings
Would have given them more star for the food it's ours just order of snow crabs problem was that about a 1/4 of the legs we're empty no meat inside
The scallops were much smaller than usual.
I been coming here for years..love the food and fast service
This place has been the best always. Simply put, the best place you can go to with family and not spend over the top. Food has always been great.
If you want fried seafood that won't break the bank out on City Island, this is the place to go. It's basic and that is A-OK. Scallops and clams were the big winners.

Went to reminisce from my childhood and it did not disappoint. The fried fish, clams and shrimp taste the same. Added the fried lobster tail which is now my favorite. Didn't want the crowd so went in a weekday just to play it safe. Ppl friendly, service great and still a nice place to chill and eat seafood. Forgot the corn though...must go back.
Our Favorite place since childhood
Does fried whities is delicious The shrimp sauce delicious you can eat it right there or take it home with you ..
Old-school fish spot that brings the memories with good fried food. You can't beat the price, drinks or nostalgic atmosphere.  Brings me back to my youth every single time.
My childhood place to eat at cut
Me encanta comer alli muy bueno el seafood

For A quick bite of seafood, Johnny's Reef is the place to go!  I've been going since I was a child.  They don‚Äôt disappoint!  If you eat outside,  be careful of the seagulls...they love Johnny's too!  Enjoy!üòã
Tasty food at great prices, how can you beat that!!
Fried shrimp, crab legs ave fried lobster tails are phenomenal.

I have been going here since being a child and this place has never disappointed. The staff here is great and the food is top notch. Have always made it a point to be here at least once a year and that is not changing anytime soon.
Still a family favorite for over 40 years. Great food, freshly prepared quickly. Remember, I almost forgot, they only take cash.
Muy rico la variedad de mariscos üòã

Just came back again and as usual this place just hits I truly like the vibe the views just overall a dope spot in city island

Been coming here since I was a kid. place has change a lot but over all I think it got better. I enjoyed today.  Food was good shrimp was good overall cool spot as usual. not my go to anymore in city island but never a miss. Worth it

Came back again for Mother‚Äôs Day and like always this place just brings back so many memories

They changed their French fries and it‚Äôs was a good change it was so good loved it had the fried whitening and the red snapper both was amazing the red snapper definitely worth the extra price.

This place will always be what it is to me because of memories I‚Äôm glad they are taking steps to do new things so more people can start to make memories and have new generations here to enjoy good food for good prices.

My ig is @imbroke_eats & @imbroke_rob
For very good fast food seafood it's probably the very best
The place is really nice. I love the views, the food is delicious, the workers are polite. The frog legs were really good! Quick service too!

My friend and I ate here on a Saturday afternoon.

The food prices have gone up considerably, no longer making this place a go to, to save $$$.

The food tasted ok, but for about the same price, I'll go to a real restaurant and be served higher quality seafood.

OVERALL: I cautiously recommend this restaurant.
Ok for Quick fast seafood
Love this place. Cant get enough of it. Atmosphere is great. It's super casual.
Excellent

EDITED: i still love this place but what they‚Äôve done with the soup is insane. They have let these chunks of potatoes dilute the great taste it once had with starch. They been doing this for a while now, for I‚Äôm assuming are cost reasons, but now the taste of it is too dull on the tongue.

I know the restaurant sells too much of it to actually care about this, but if y‚Äôall want to fix the taste while eating it. Take out as much potato as you want, add water and  add resalt. It brings out the some of that flavor it once had .ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Been coming here since I was in my
Mother‚Äôs womb. Best soup and best fried seafood in nyc!
It was divine.
My dad used to take me and my brother here when we were kids.  Still as good as I remember it
Always get the shrimp & calamari with a Pi√±a colada
Its been a while since I've come and they still are delicious. The fries have changed, but their pi√±a coladas are still yummy.
Awesome
The food was very quickly prepared and was very tasty.
18.00 will buy you a delicious shrimp and chips dinner.
Had dinner with my daughter sitting by the water nice evening out for dinner had a wonderful time üòÄ
Great food and the view is beautiful.
Good Seafood.
must try seafood place!
Food is cheaper but it's like fast food.  Can't complain.  I call it the poor man spot.

Classic, casual seaside restaurant, portions are huge, everything is fresh. Scallops are huge and cooked perfectly. French fries and coke are good too. There's a reason this place has been around so long. Cash only, be prepared. There's a full bar as well.  Kids can get burgers, dogs or nugs. Order and pay at the counter and dining is cafeteria style with great  view of the Long Island sound/East Chester Sound with the Throg Neck bridge in the distance. We make the trip every time we visit NYC, it's worth it. Not a fancy place, just great food and lots of it.

Classic staple place to eat if you grew up in The Bronx. Service is always quick & easy. Food is always fresh & delicious. Atmosphere is nostalgic. To eat/drink by any body of water is always a welcomed & sought after experience. I've loved coming here all my life.

Great seafood spot with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. They‚Äôve even added wire overhead to keep the seagulls from swooping in while you eat, a thoughtful touch! The line to order moves quickly, and while some reviews mention the food being pre-fried, my experience was completely different. My order came straight out of the fryer, fresh, hot, and delicious. The place is spotless, and staff promptly clean tables as soon as guests leave. Fast service, fresh food, and a clean, welcoming atmosphere
I‚Äôll definitely be back!

I‚Äôve been coming to Johnnys since I was a child. It‚Äôs located at the back of city island on the left hand side. Cash only establishment with plenty of parking. Amazing outside view of the water. They also provide a portion of the outside seating with a covered section so you don‚Äôt have to directly be in the sun. Ordered the usual basket of Fried Shrimp üç§ and a basket of Lobster tails. It definitely hit the spot Johnnys always had the best tartare sauce on city island d nothing compares. Staff is always friendly respectable and hard working remember to tip.

I‚Äôve been coming to this spot since I was a child. It was always one of my favorite places to come with family. Today I was so disappointed. The quality of the food went down so much. They fry their shrimp in batches to have ready to serve and it‚Äôs was room temperature. Also, I‚Äôm no fool. These shrimp weren‚Äôt fresh. They fried frozen shrimp from the supermarket. I know they didn‚Äôt take the time to remove the tails from each one. Their shrimp always come with the tail.  Cheaper in quality but give you about 30 small (frozen) shrimp. :-/

Don't be turned away by the line! Johnny's was my first stop of trying City Island, and it did not disappoint. The establish is well organized, making the line move quickly. The shrimp and fish baskets were huge! Packed with lots of food and lots of flavor!

Johnny's is a city island legendary spot always a go to for the summer and its right by the water with a view of the Throggs Neck Bridge. You can get any type of seafood here fried or steamed. The drinks are good too just make sure you bring cash they dont take cards

Red Snaper fried was ok, and the lobsters tails. The shrimps not that great they tasted like refried, and they should serve in a bigger basket for the amount of food. And the kicker is 2 dollars for a cup with a little bit of ice, definitely thats a ripped off. I understand you have to charge, but 2 dollars is a fountain drink everywhere.  2 dollars for an Ice cup is a no no, Never seen it, and it was hard to digest. The people and atmosphere were good.

Good seafood restaurant right by the waters. Be prepared to neighbor with the seagulls. They do have lines above that prevent the bigger birds from flying in, which is very much appreciated.

The fried calamari was delicious and the little neck clams were fresh. Good cocktail sauce and linguine/clams.

The ordering can be a little confusing for a first timer. They have different ordering booths for fried, steamed, drinks, sodas etc. whatever you see on the menu above, that‚Äôs likely what you can order in that area.

Cash only!
Casual seafood restaurant. Great portions and quick service! Food is very good. We had the fried shrimp and fish filet. Very good and prices are reasonable for seafood.

We recently visited this outdoor fish and chips restaurant with our family, including four kids in fifth and sixth grades, my wife, and her mother. While the food was reasonably priced and had an average taste, the overall experience was marred by the environment. There were numerous people smoking cigarettes and marijuana not only in the parking lot but also at the dining tables. Despite the staff being aware, no action was taken to address it, which made the atmosphere quite unpleasant, and unsafe

I love this place.   I have been coming here for 38yrs and they are still the same.  Lines can get long, but they have an effective system, so you move fast. Sea Food is simple but good.  Not the place to go if you want fancy.  Atmosphere is nice.  Everyone was hanging out, just enjoying themselves and the food.  I love it as much as I did 38yrs ago.
Great place  I loved it cant say enough  wonderful  people  behind  the counters

My family and I have been coming here for years. We love the fried shrimp and fries üçü. The frog legs are okay but the pina colada is great (perfect consistently). Manhattan clam chowder is really good and the size is good.
Food was delicious. My first time there. They give you some healthy portions.  Money we'll spent!

When it comes to delicious fried seafood, this spot is easily one of the best places you can go. From the moment you walk in, the aroma alone lets you know you‚Äôre about to enjoy something special. The menu is full of fresh options, from golden fried shrimp to perfectly crisp fish, each seasoned with just the right blend of spices. Every bite delivers that satisfying crunch on the outside while staying tender and flavorful on the inside.

What sets this place apart is not just the quality of the food but also the atmosphere. Whether you‚Äôre stopping by for a quick bite, bringing family along for a casual dinner, or meeting friends for a relaxed evening out, the vibe is always welcoming. The portions are generous, making it great value for both your appetite and your wallet. Pair your meal with their sides‚Äîlike crispy fries, coleslaw, or hush puppies‚Äîand you‚Äôve got the perfect combination for a hearty, comforting meal.

Beyond the food, the service adds to the experience. The staff is attentive, friendly, and clearly takes pride in what they do. They make you feel right at home, which only enhances the overall dining experience. It‚Äôs the kind of place where you‚Äôll want to return again and again, not just for the amazing seafood but also for the warm and inviting atmosphere.

If you‚Äôre a fan of fried seafood‚Äîor even if you‚Äôre just looking to treat yourself to a flavorful and satisfying meal‚Äîyou won‚Äôt regret checking this spot out. It‚Äôs truly one of the best places to go for good fried seafood, and it will quickly become one of your favorite go-to destinations whenever the craving hits.

The food all taste like the same dry fried taste no dimension nor seasoning. My friends and I ordered everything on the menu and were not impressed. Tables are bit dirty. Drinks are okay. Other places on city island that are better. My biggest problem was raw things not served on ice. Lack of sides almost everything served with fries. I won‚Äôt be back. Don‚Äôt get the hype.
The food is great and the weather was perfect to sit outside and enjoy a strawberry daiquiri and steamed crab legs
Great fish & chips, generous portion at reasonable price for these days. Great views, too. Cash only! (They have ATMs)

Made my annual cycling pilgrimage here from Long Island. If you visit City island on a bicycle then Johnny‚Äôs Reef is a must. ü•áü•á

This venue easily accommodates 100 or more cyclists with a water view and outdoor seating.

The vibes are good üëç. I noticed majority of the crowd have some fried seafood and a beer.

A 16 oz Corona is only $5 & Coors lite is $4. Tax included. CASH ONLY.

My shrimp basket with fries went well with a corona. I generally don‚Äôt drink while cycling but today was an exception.

Very likely the busiest venue in city island. I noticed all the locals come here especially the off duty bus drivers üëç.

This place is a staple to one's childhood memories. Third generations come to this place for so many occasions but mainly for the seafood. My mom feels such nostalgia every time I bring her here because it reminds her of her mom and when she was a child.
Es genial y apto para llevar a la familia tiene una vista muy peculiar para el lago a los ni√±os les gusta pasarle comida a las gaviotas
Well oiled machine. They have a variety of seafood here, steamed or fried. It was just fine for the price. And cash only was a bit annoying.
First time here. The food was good and I didn't have to wait long.

First time in City Island! As soon as you enter the restaurant there is a long line, there are many seafood option to choose from either broil or fried. I chose the fried lobster tail and shrimps and it was delicious. I also enjoyed the thick cut French fries and the tartar sauce. There was a lot of outdoor seating towards the back which is nice and relaxing. Definitely recommend just don‚Äôt feed the seagulls üòä

Always fresh tasty seafood. I switch between the fried shrimp and fried fish. My wife likes the fried oysters. Lots of parking and plenty of outdoor seating. Great water views of sailboats and jet skiers.

A bit of a trek from Manhattan, but if you wanna treat yourself + friends to fresh buckets of cherry stones, little necks, oysters and scallops at an unbeatable price, this is the chill spot albeit a bit deep (*gotta take the 6 to the end of the line in Pelham Bay, then get on the Bx29 bus toward Orchard Beach)

The fillet of sole was all of that and some chips.  The French fries were freshly cut and fried to perfection and so was the fish.    Great service doesn‚Äôt take long for your food to be fried on the spot so you know it‚Äôs fresh and this place stays packed with people. Do you know the food is moving.  The corn on the cob with the melted butter will have you  closing your eyes. Tbe view is perfect close to the water you can sit outside and enjoy the ljve scenery of people sailing, jet skiing. Great place happy eating

My first time here and it def won‚Äôt be my last! I wasn‚Äôt too happy about the strawberry daiquiris but the henny coladas were good but it did need a little more slosh! The shrimp and fries were really good and the views were beautiful! I didn‚Äôt like the fact that it was cash only and there was only one atm. For only accepting cash there should be at least 3 atms to avoid long lines with frustrated hungry and thirsty people. Other than that I would def. like to come back again in the summer and have some more drinks and shrimp!

Lets just say I was reminiscing on the good ole days when Johnny's seafood was the best and quality was fresh. Came in with a table of 6 and the majority came for the lobster tails and red snapper. What a disappointment with the size of the lobster tails! They are so small and prices doubled !!! I get it...inflation and everything eventually goes up but quality of food has changed drastically! I substituted fries for vegetables...why were the vegetables not fresh but so soggy I wouldn't feed my dog that! Should be ashamed to serve those over cooked disgusting veggies!
The line was out the door but it was going fast. Had my friend complain about shrimp tasting different and fries were not as fresh as before. Huge disappointment... I ll venture off to a better quality sea food in the area. I was loyal for over 35yrs. So sad!

My husband and I were eager to experience this establishment. I regret to inform you that the food was unsatisfactory. The food lacked flavor, and also, the individual who placed our food in the take-home tray was cleaning the restrooms and emptying the trash before approaching us, without washing her hands prior to handling our food. Nevertheless, the meal was going in the trash anyhow. I would give this location a rating of zero if possible. If you are seeking a rapid seafood establishment in City Island, I advise avoiding this place. The food is not good.

Cash only!!
Lobster tail steam comes in 5 small ones for $36. Fresh and delicious. I recommend it. Snow crab legs are uncomfortable to eat because there are no tools. I ordered 1 dozen little necks, but it's a little salty. They serve clam soup as a cup, but it's too salty.

Cute place to sit outside and enjoy seafood. Portions are plentiful. Only thing I didn't like was once you went to order your food you cannot order everything on the same line. Fried food, steamed, salad are different lines. Other than that it's a kool place to visit!
Good food and atmosphere. Great for casual. Love their fried seafood and fries. Do not order non-fried food. Their lobster had zero taste. Everything else was delicious, especially the fried food.
Great Food with very fast service. Very fresh!
Johnny's Reef in City Island good place to go for seafood enjoy the ocean outside view eat out doors. Enjoyed Calamari, shrimp with fries, lobsters, drinks sodas, beer.

Beautiful view and delicious food with reasonable price. There are so many selection to choose from. It‚Äôs very comfortable to sit outdoors when the weather is good to enjoy the nice view. Staffs are friendly. Would totally come visit again!

Food was so Good.!!! Very fast line Tartar sauce is the best I have ever try.! The only bad thing is people who go there are smoking w..d EVERYWHERE.! We were seated outside with my little daughter and it gets me mad that she has to be smelling this when she doesn‚Äôt have too.!!  WHY PEOPLE DOESNT GET THAT THIS IS A FAMILY RESTAURANT.! The parking full of people drinking and smoking I hope this changes because the restaurant is really good at a very nice location

It's world famous! At least that's what the sign says. I did like it very much. It's cash only so don't pull out the plastic. Fish filets are huge. All portions seemed to be big and a good value. Outdoor seating was fun. They keep the birds away with clever wiring. Good view.

It was a cafeteria type atmosphere. I found it to not be sanitary. I ordered shrimp salad and got cocktail shrimp on lattice with four over sliced tomatoes there was no taste to the dressing. I won't be going back . Parking was tight.
